info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 19 at 5:46PM CDT until May 19 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT FOR CLINTON...WASHINGTON AND NORTHEASTERN ST. CLAIR COUNTIES... At 545 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Trenton to near Coulterville, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Breese, Trenton, Aviston, St. Rose, Jamestown, Nashville, Ashley, Centralia, Irvington, Wamac and Shattuc. This also includes Carlyle Lake Recreational Area. This includes Interstate 64 in Illinois between exits 23 and 61. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for south central and southwestern Illinois. A tornado watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, if one is spotted act quickly and move to a place of safety inside a sturdy structure, such as a basement or small interior room. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
